menu.op4: Do you want us to include your journal?

formulario.descripcion: In AURA, AmeliCA aims to reflect the general state of scholarly journals concerning open access policies and exploitation rights of scholarly publishing. AURA’s goal is to know publishing policies of scholarly journals concerning access to their files, exploitation rights and publishing licenses, and how they affect self-archive in institutional or thematic repositories. Journals are classified by colours in accordance with DULCINEA’s and SHERPA/ROMEO’s taxonomy.

informacionRevistas.otraInstitucion: If you don't see the institution you're looking for, add other institution
informacionRevistas.organoSmall: Only for journals from learned societies
informacionRevistas.mesesEmbargo: If the journal has an embargo period, what is its length?
informacionRevistas.derechos: Is the holder of exploitation rights of contents specifically mentioned in the journal?
informacionRevistas.titularDerechos: Choose who holds the exploitation rights of the journal’s contents (copyright)
informacionRevistas.urlDerechos: Provide the link to such section
informacionRevistas.licencia: Choose the license used to publish contents
informacionRevistas.urlLicencia: URL to the section where license is indicated.
informacionRevistas.urlInstrucciones: URL to the authors’ guidelines section.
informacionRevistas.cuandoAutoarchivo: If self-archive is permitted, when could it be done?
informacionRevistas.colorRomeo: The color Romeo has been assigned based on the version of the self-file
informacionRevistas.titularDerechosSmall: Within the 'Institution' option, the publishing institution, the editor, and/or the journal are included.
informacionRevistas.issnNoValido: Incorrect data, please check your ISSN. E.g., 1234-587X
informacionRevistas.existenciaIssn: You must enter at least one ISSN

acceso.gratuitoOnline: Free online - subscription for printed version

autoArchivos.articulosOA: Yes in OA articles with article processing charges (APCs)
